actions.name: archive

actions.description: Transfers the ownership of the repository to a new owner with a new name

params.name: permission
params.description: The permission level to grant the collaborator. One of: pull, triage, push, maintain, admin. Default: push

actions.name: createTree

params.name: base
params.description: The base tree SHA

params.name: path
params.description: The file path of the new tree object

params.name: tree
params.description: The SHA of the tree to modify

actions.description: Creates a new tree within the repository based on the provided parameters

actions.name: createFileTree
actions.description: Creates a new file tree within the repository based on the provided parameters

params.name: keyPrefix
params.description: The prefix to match issue text against like `T-`

params.name: urlTemplate
params.description: The URL template to use for autolinking issues. Should include `<num>`

params.name: alphanumeric
params.description: `true` if link can contain letters, `false` if numbers only

types.name: IssueCollection

fields.name: one
fields.description: Get a single issue by its number

fields.name: search

params.name: q
params.description: Github API returns pull requests in the issues endpoint. Use this to include/exclude them. Can be either issue or pr

params.name: sort
params.description: What to sort results by. Can be created, updated, comments.

params.name: order
params.description: One of asc (ascending) or desc (descending).

fields.description: Search for issues based on specified criteria

fields.name: page

params.name: kind
params.description: Github API returns pull requests in the issues endpoint. Use this to include/exclude them. Can be either issue or pr

params.name: milestone
params.description: If an integer is passed, it should refer to a milestone by its number field. If the string * is passed, issues with any milestone are accepted. If the string none is passed, issues without milestones are returned.

params.name: state
params.description: Indicates the state of the issues to return. Can be open, closed, or all.

params.name: assignee
params.description: Can be the name of a user. Pass in none for issues with no assigned user, and * for issues assigned to any user.

params.name: creator
params.description: The user that created the issue.

params.name: mentioned
params.description: A user that's mentioned in the issue.

params.name: labels
params.description: A list of comma separated label names. Example: bug,ui,@high

params.name: sort
params.description: What to sort results by. Can be created, updated, comments.

params.name: direction
params.description: One of asc (ascending) or desc (descending).

params.name: since
params.description: Only show notifications updated after the given time. This is a timestamp in ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ

fields.description: Retrieve a page of issues based on specified criteria

types.description: Collection of Github issues

fields.description: The HTML URL of the issue

params.name: state
params.description: Must be one of 'open' or 'closed'

fields.description: How the author is associated with the repository. Can be one of: COLLABORATOR, CONTRIBUTOR, FIRST_TIMER, FIRST_TIME_CONTRIBUTOR, MANNEQUIN, MEMBER, NONE, OWNER

fields.description: The text of the review. Can be null.
